2.title: Edgar, "Loser Blues"
2.author: story, Sweeney ; pencils, Edgar, inks, Valentino
2.appears_in: p. 30 in Fire Sale : a Benefit for Larry Todd (Auburn, CA : Rip Off Press, 1989).

3.heading: Edgar.
3.title: "Animals and Little Kids. They're Always Smarter than They Look"
3.author: Lynn.
3.series: For Better or For Worse, June 25, 1998
notes: Summary: Edgar knows he's going somewhere he doesn't want to, and April wonders why her dad doesn't just say it's to the kennel.

4.heading: Edgar.
4.title: "Dad's Down on All Fours, Scratching the Dog"
4.author: by Lynn Johnston.
4.series: For Better or For Worse, Aug. 23, 1999
notes: Summary: Edgar is driving John crazy with his scratching.

5.heading: Edgar.
5.title: "He's Just a Dumb Animal who Thinks I'm His Mother!"
5.author: Lynn.
5.series: For Better or For Worse, Sept. 25, 1998
notes: Summary: Elly feels guilty about leaving Edgar alone.

6.heading: Edgar.
6.title: "I Forgot. He Hates the Soaps"
6.author: Lynn.
6.series: For Better or For Worse, Sept. 23, 1998
notes: Summary: Elly leaves Edgar home, with the TV on for company, and Edgar howls.

7.heading: Edgar.
7.title: "I Get the Icing"
7.author: Lynn.
7.series: For Better or For Worse, Mar. 2, 1999
notes: Summary: Edgar and April share a piece of cake.

8.heading: Edgar.
8.title: "In a Few Days, We'll All Be Back to Normal"
8.author: Lynn.
8.series: For Better or For Worse, June 7, 2002
notes: Summary: Grandpa and Dixie have moved out, and the family misses them, including Edgar who's thinking about Dixie.

9.heading: Edgar.
9.title: "Never Say the Word 'Walk' When You're Leaving"
9.author: Lynn.
9.series: For Better or For Worse, Sept. 22, 1998
notes: Summary: Edgar's lonesome, and bounds out the door at the promise of a walk after work.

10.heading: Edgar.
10.title: "That Should Distract Him"
10.author: by Lynn Johnston.
10.series: For Better or For Worse, Sept. 24, 1998
notes: Summary: Elly hides doggie treats around the house to occupy Edgar so she can leave for work.

11.heading: Edgar.
11.title: "Tomorrow I'll Walk Him AFTER Dinner"
11.author: Lynn.
11.series: For Better or For Worse, June 13, 1998
notes: Summary: Grandpa takes Edgar for a walk, with Edgar anticipating his dog food at home.

13.heading: Edgar the Mole.
13.title: Once Upon a Forest
13.author: screenplay by Kelly Ward and Mark Young ; based upon a concept and characters created by Rae Lambert ; adapted by Jill Wolf.
